License Restriction Violation - Class A, B, or C Vehicle (2nd)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik Cadena was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
*Not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
*No jail credit
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence he is currently serving

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay a fine of $600 plus costs and surcharges 
*Defendant is required to authorize the department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account to be used for payment of obligations in reasonable amounts as determined by DOC. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

*Provide DNA sample, if requested
*Comply with other assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent

supervisions.notes: *Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erik Cadena

records.addlTxt:
Count 1:  Prison Sentence with Extended Supervision
Count 2:  Dismissed and Read In
Count 3:  Dismissed and Read In
Count 4:  Dismissed and Read In

11:28 AM Defendant Erik Cadena in court, in custody.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Erik Cadena. 
Court calls the case.
Atty Pfeil states the appearances. 

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Atty Pfeil states they do not have results of blood withdrawal back from the lab.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1- Guilty

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1. 
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction this date.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is present and approves the agreement as stated. 
Victim is not present.

Atty Pfeil makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Mcfarland makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Mr. Cadena makes statements to the court.

Court states findings for the record. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1- 
Prison sentence:
18 months initial confinement, 48 months extended supervision
Consecutive to any other sentence serving
Not eligible for substance abuse program or challenge incarceration program
No jail credit
Conditions:
Pay fine of $600 plus costs and surcharges
Provide DNA sample if requested
Ignition interlock device for 3 years
Driver's license revocation for life
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with assessment
Obtain AODA with DOT and comply with any safety plan in future
Comply with any other assessment as deemed appropriate by agent

Count 2-
Dismissed, read in

Count 3-
Dismissed, read in

Count 4-
Dismissed, read in

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:08 PM Defendant Erik Cadena in court, in custody.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Erik Cadena. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty McFarland.

1:41 PM Defendant Erik Cadena appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Anne Renc appears on behalf of the defendant.   Attorney Brian J Pfeil for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for March 14, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 1

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

AGENCY #:  C22-02132

1:04 p.m.  Defendant Erik Cadena appeared by video, in custody.   Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 5th, Operate While Revoked and Resisting or Obstructing an Officer (2 counts).
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $5,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule objects to the cash bond requested by the State and states her objections on the record.
Defendant is public defender eligible. 

BY THE COURT:
Court will set a $3,000 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
